January 2021 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Even if 2021 is already some days old, we would like to wish you and your family a happy, prosperous, and healthy New Year! Your hard work and commitment allowed us to overcome the challenges we faced in 2020 and end the year strong. As we start this new year, we are looking forward to a great year ahead. Get yourself 2021 ready!

Milestones & Accomplishments

Letâ€™s Find Out Whatâ€™s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia Releaser: We released a tool that will streamline the technical documentation process for Justia teams that work directly with code. It is a huge time-saver.

Automation QA: Related to our automated QA efforts, we upgraded the client blogs automated QA to make it more efficient and generate better reports. We also integrated the directory automated QA with every update that goes live, in addition to the monthly scheduled check.

Regulations Content Update: This is content that we already had on our website. But now, we have streamlined the process to update it promptly quarterly and with minimal effort.

Mexico Portal Content: As usual, we continue adding new content for our visitors. This month, we posted Family Law content to the Mexico portal.

"Thank You" Blast: We are closing the year by thanking all our Justia clients and directory clients. We showed our appreciation to users for being part of the Justia community this year.

On the podcast, Stacy and Tim discussed how they came to start FindLaw and Justia, their hard work over 25 years, and their plans to keep providing free access to law.

NEW INTERNS | NEW FULL TIME EMPLOYEES

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Kara Simon

Editorial Team

Hello all, my name is Kara Simon, and I am the newest member of the Editorial Team. I am based in Chicago, Illinois, but originally from Cleveland, Ohio. I have a BA in Writing and followed that with a JD after a year as a freelance writer and consultant. My newest talent is learning to boulder, and I have the blisters to prove it. I love the opportunity to try new things, and I look forward to getting to know the Justia team.

Marina Wilson

Marketing Team

Hi everyone! My name is Marina Wilson. I am (almost) 28 years old, and I am from the New Orleans, Louisiana area. I have a bachelor's in Consumer Journalism from the University of Georgia and got my JD at LSU. When I am not at work, I am usually at a football game, spending time with my family and friends, or planning my next weekend adventure. I also have an English Bulldog that I love to take along for outings. I am looking forward to meeting you all and am glad to have joined the team at Justia!

COMPANY EVENTS

Ugly Sweater Contest

Justia held its 2020 Ugly Sweater contest on Monday, December 14, at the end of our team meeting. We thank all entrants who had the chance to show off their sweaters. Congratulations to the winners who claimed the bragging rights to the title until next year and the Amazon gift card prizes.

WELLNESS

5 Apps to Start 2021 in a More Organized Way.

Habit List: The road to becoming more organized starts with building better habits. Habit List lets you list habits you'd like to improve, whether it's exercising more, eating healthier, or just getting chores done.

Unroll.Me: How much time do you spend going through and deleting unwanted emails that clutter your inbox? Unroll.Me compiles all of your email list subscriptions into one daily email. It delivers greater control of your email lists, letting you unsubscribe from all unwanted emails in just one click and organizing the rest.

Things: Things is a great organizational app that helps you break down your to-do lists into manageable tasks. You can design your calendar in the order you want to see your events: personal, family, work, and more. Set up a separate to-do list for evenings only for tasks you need to handle when you get home.

RescueTime: RescueTime is designed to do exactly what its name infers, save time. It records your digital footprint and keeps track of everything you do onlineâ€”on websites and applicationsâ€”and how much time you spend doing each activity.

Cozi: Any parent knows that organizing family activities is no easy task. Cozi is a family activity app that will help you schedule all doctor's appointments, youth soccer games, and more on a daily calendar that sends you reminders so that you never miss an important event again.
